alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Kimball, southwestern Banner and east central Laramie Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 229 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gun Barrel to 6 miles northeast of Burns. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Albin, Oliver Campground and Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska near mile marker 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska...and southeastern Wyoming.
